intro: Anemia jaliscana var. integrifolia, commonly known as the Mexican anemone, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white or pink petals. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a smooth or slightly toothed margin. It produces small, aggregate fruits that contain numerous seeds dispersed by wind.
